definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to cost/to spend/fee/wasteful/expenses
surname Fei
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: This is what we have, rather dully, taken care to affirm at first.
sentences.chinese: 这个是我们曾经费心来处理，起初是用来作为肯定。

sentences.english: He tried in vain to write down the movement.
sentences.chinese: 他枉费心机地写文章诋毁这场运动。

sentences.english: Panel painting involved a painstaking , laborious process.
sentences.chinese: 镶板绘画是个费心费力的过程。

sentences.english: Don't bother chamfering the edges until the end.
sentences.chinese: 不用费心管倒角孔的边缘，直到结束。

sentences.english: I tried to attract her attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想引起他的注意，却枉费心机。

sentences.english: My brother-in-law said loudly, to bother you.
sentences.chinese: 高声说我的小舅子，劳你费心了。

sentences.english: The consumption of God to work, have rich harvest.
sentences.chinese: 有了耗神费心的劳作，才有了丰厚的收获。

sentences.english: Less than 40 per cent of businesses bother to check academic and professional qualifications.
sentences.chinese: 不足40百分号的企业会费心核查教育和职业资历。
她的谨慎只是枉费心机。

sentences.english: Geminis are impossible to predict, so we shouldn't bother trying.
sentences.chinese: 双子座的人无法预料，所以我们也无须费心去尝试了。

sentences.english: Olmsted wrote often and thought hard about the words he used.
sentences.chinese: 奥姆斯特德经常写作，往往费心思考自己的用词。

sentences.english: I am afraid you will be futile.
'In vain, ' quoth she, 'I live, and seek in vain.
sentences.chinese: “我枉自活着，”她说，“而我又枉费心思。

sentences.english: I tried to attract his attention, but failed.
sentences.chinese: 我想要引起他的注意，却枉费心机。

sentences.english: To depend on your memory without studying for a test is to grasp at straws.
sentences.chinese: 应付考试光靠好记性而不用功是枉费心机。

sentences.english: You got me chasin' rabbits, pickin' out rings and Howlin' At The Moon.
sentences.chinese: 是你让我心烦意乱，费心选戒，对着月亮长吁短叹。

definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to worry about
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to worry/to be on one's mind
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
to spend (money or time)
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
concerned/troubled/having sth on one's mind
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
with all of one's heart
to do sth in place of sb else
to think through/to invest effort in thinking about/to consider thoroughly
to take great pains/to go to a lot of trouble
